title: Energy unlimited: nuclear research at Lucas Heights
creator_credit: Australian Atomic Energy Commission and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
brief_description: The history of the Atomic Research Establishment at Lucas Heights near Sydney and a description of its work in atomic research and in producing radio-isotopes for industry and medicine. Includes the construction of the buildings; the official opening by the Prime Minister, the Rt. Hon. R.G. Menzies in 1958; the functioning of the research reactor.
